intro: Cassinopsis capensis, commonly known as the Cape cassinella, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It produces edible fruits that are typically consumed raw or cooked. Cassinopsis capensis is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils.
